text: I’m generating simple plots with `Plots.plot()`, and attempting to set line width, e.g., `plot(rand(20), linewidth=4)` and GR; however it seems that the linewidth value has no effect - is there a known issue or something I need to do to make line width change?

elements.text: , and attempting to set line width, e.g.,
and GR; however it seems that the linewidth value has no effect - is there a known issue or something I need to do to make line width change?

text: that was a bug a couple weeks ago in GR try updating/using master

elements.text: that was a bug a couple weeks ago in GR try updating/using master

text: Thanks <@U8HHPBKQR> - I was responding when your message popped up.  I forgot that sometime during my upgrade to 1.6 (more or less), I developed dirty registry issues that were preventing updates of Plots.  I deleted the General registry under ~/.julia and I was then able to to `up Plots`  and that resolved this issue as you suggested
